programmes.show_description: Ian Stewart. Bestselling author, Helen Bailey, was a wealthy widow. After finding love again with Ian Stewart she vanished. He helps in the search - but was it a cover-up? S2, Ep6
Fadi Nasri & Miles Evans. When Nisha Patel-Nasri is stabbed on her doorstep, is her husband, Fadi's TV appeal fake? And Miles Evans is a suspect when his stepdaughter Zoe vanishes. S2, Ep7
Tragedy Comes In Pairs. In the desert town of Socorro, New Mexico, Crystal Houston is found murdered just 14 months after her sister, Stephanie, is killed in a suspicious accident. S5, Ep3
Voice of Terror. In the late 1970s, the FBI had knowledge of anti-Castro terrorists operating in the US. Then, a new group appeared, more violent than their predecessors. S7, Ep1
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Undercover Sting. Animal Cops come to the rescue of a desperate cat stuck down a drain deep underground. Plus, they help an abandoned dog in danger of freezing to death. S12, Ep2
From the Ashes. See how arson investigators gather physical evidence and mount undercover and sting operations to crack insurance torchings and arson murders. S2, Ep9
Living in Terror. See how, in the 1993 World Trade Center bombing, DNA was traced to the bomber through the saliva that remained on the back of a mailing label. S2, Ep10
Operation Seaload. A closer look at real FBI cases - from murders to robberies - with dramatic re-enactments and interviews with agents and forensic scientists who work in the investigations. S7, Ep9

Brothers Betrayed. A closer look at real FBI cases - from murders to robberies - with dramatic re-enactments and interviews with agents and forensic scientists who work in the investigations. S7, Ep11
Michelle Gunshon. In December 2004, 38-year-old Michelle Gunshon went missing. Police believed Michelle had been murdered and that their prime suspect was on the run. S5, Ep1
For Better or for Worse. When Butch Halley finds love with Sunny, he can't wait to start their new life together. But sinister rumours soon threaten to tear the family apart. S1, Ep5
The Long Way Home. 35-year-old mum Deanne Hastings leaves a note that she's running to the store, but never returns. As detectives find more information, troubling theories emerge. S8, Ep13
Nowhere Girl. In 2020, Dioneth Lopez's body turned up in the woodlands of Washington State. Detectives must find surveillance to piece together her final hour. S9, Ep13
Harry Jarvis. Harry Jarvis murdered his wife in the basement. As the truth was revealed, his son, Graham, had to face the fact that his father was a killer. S5, Ep3
Life On The Lake. Gil and his family are living an idyllic existence until an accident changes everything. Just as Gill seems to have moved on, someone close hatches a deadly plot. S7, Ep17
Safe At Home. After years of searching for love, Doris thinks she's finally hit the jackpot with an old friend named Mark. But something dark is taking hold of their marriage. S7, Ep18

programmes.show_name: American Detective With Lt Joe Kenda
programmes.show_description: A former mayor of an Ohio town turns up dead in his hunting cabin. Detective Ryan Allar explores whether this is political retaliation or something more personal. S2, Ep1
Danielle Jones. In 2001, 15-year-old Danielle Jones disappeared on her way to school. Two decades on, her family still fight for justice. S5, Ep6
Toying With Us. In 2013, 35-year-old assistant manager Larry Wells is murdered in his office. Police follow a trail of surveillance footage to track down the disguised killer. S9, Ep8
The Serial Killer Who Only Killed Once. The weekend before Thanksgiving, a killer slays Robin Lawrence at home while her child is asleep. A relentless investigation circles her husband. S9, Ep8
Obsession To Do Evil. On Friday the 13th, a Satan-obsessed teen stalks a Texas town. As bodies fall, survivors fight and cops race to end the nightmare before dawn. S1, Ep1
Ticket To Murder. In Dalton, Georgia, a convenience store employee is stabbed at work. Security footage reveals a disturbing revelation about the killer's identity. S8, Ep15
Levi Bellfield. Levi Bellfield denied his connection to a series of murders and rapes, but videotaped police interviews tell a different story. Experts spot the giveaway signs. S3, Ep1
Chris Parker. Experts analyse a man's deception following the Manchester Arena terror attack. Police tapes expose a man who murdered his wife and hid her body in the freezer. S3, Ep2
Hellfire In The Hollow. When a 21-year-old mother doesn't return from night classes and her car is found burned, foul play is suspected. The web of lies that unfolds is shocking. S5, Ep4
Dangerous Case. In the late '70s, a terrorist group is suspected of setting off bombs in major US cities. Their goal: to bring attention to the Puerto Rican independence movement. S7, Ep2
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
A Fresh Start. Animal Cops discover a Doberman in an alarming state; its claws are so long they've grown into the pads of its feet. The dog is rescued but can its leg be saved? S12, Ep3
Traces of Guilt. Discover how a few milligrams of forensic evidence can be crucial to a crime investigation and prove the innocence or guilt of the accused. S3, Ep1
Lethal Obsessions. Exploring the mind of the obsessive murderer, following the work of psychologists as they study the muddled workings of the criminal psyche. S3, Ep2
Stolen Identity. A closer look at real FBI cases - from murders to robberies - with dramatic re-enactments and interviews with agents and forensic scientists who work in the investigations. S7, Ep12
Robin the Hood. A closer look at real FBI cases - from murders to robberies - with dramatic re-enactments and interviews with agents and forensic scientists who work in the investigations. S7, Ep13
Levi Bellfield. Levi Bellfield is a serial killer responsible for the horrific murders of three young women. His ex-partner reveals how his crimes have affected her. S1, Ep4
Texas Rangers. Examines the history and modern evolution of the Texas Rangers, who were formed in the 1830s to protect settlers against attacks from natives. S3, Ep11
Bad Medicine. A thought-provoking look at how drug trafficking has spawned a violent and deadly criminal underground. S3, Ep12
Unlikely Sources. How baffling crimes have been solved through evidence provided by insects, beer bottles and other seemingly meaningless objects. S3, Ep13
Defenseless. When Peggy Perez-Olivo is shot in the head her husband Carlos insists they were victims of carjackers. The horror that follows will shock even experienced investigators. S5, Ep4
Prescription For Murder. Wisconsin police are shocked to find an elderly couple brutally murdered in their home. When family start receiving death threats, will murder strike again? S3, Ep13
Murder By The Book. A couple is shot in their own home but husband Dan Montecalvo survives. The investigation reveals a scheming killer who almost got away with the perfect murder. S3, Ep11
Body In The Glades. 42-year-old Miami mum Raquel Calderin vanishes without a trace on her way home from work. The investigation leads detectives into a disturbing family picture. S4, Ep2
Disappearing Act. Real estate developer Jana Koklich vanishes and police suspect her job led her into danger, until a local pastor comes forward with a shocking confession. S3, Ep12
Whidbey Island Mystery. When Russel Douglas is found shot in the head in his car on a deserted road, it sparks a decade long case that leaves many with unanswered questions. S5, Ep6
We All Go A Little Mad. Police find a family dead, a horror film still playing, a bloody mask nearby - and a letter addressed to the woman who voiced 'The Exorcist' demon. S1, Ep3
Patrol. As cameras follow the work of patrol officers, they must navigate the chaos of a high-stakes series of shootings, high-speed chases and standoffs. S1, Ep7
Fred Talbot. When arrested for historic sexual offences, TV weatherman Fred Talbot tried to hide the truth in police interviews. His repeated response of 'no comment' speaks volumes. S3, Ep3
